fields.name: Stuck Fish
fields.description: Stuck fish, often used in African cuisine, is a type of dried, smoked fish that has been split open and flattened before being dried. It has a rich, smoky flavor and firm texture, making it perfect for adding depth to soups, stews, and sauces. Popular in dishes like Egusi soup and Okra soup, stuck fish is prized for its intense umami taste that enhances traditional recipes. Ideal for home cooks seeking authentic African flavors, this product is a must-have for creating hearty, flavorful meals.

fields.name: Crayfish
fields.description: Crayfish, a popular ingredient in African cuisine, are small, dried crustaceans known for their intense umami flavor. Perfect for seasoning soups, stews, and sauces, these crayfish are sun-dried to preserve their rich, smoky taste. Whether used whole or ground into a powder, they enhance the depth and aroma of traditional dishes like Egusi soup, Jollof rice, and Okra soup. Ideal for home cooks and professional chefs looking to add authentic African flavor to their meals.

fields.name: Prawns
fields.description: Prawns are premium, high-quality seafood known for their sweet, succulent flavor and firm texture. Perfect for a wide variety of dishes, these prawns are carefully dried to preserve their natural taste, making them an excellent addition to soups, stews, stir-fries, and seafood recipes. Rich in protein and low in fat, they are a healthy choice for enhancing both traditional and modern meals. Ideal for home cooks and chefs looking to add a gourmet touch to their dishes with authentic, savory seafood.

fields.name: Dry Snails
fields.description: Snails are a delicacy prized for their tender texture and rich, earthy flavor. Carefully cleaned and prepared, these snails are perfect for a variety of dishes, including stir-fries, soups, and stews. High in protein and low in fat, they offer a healthy, gourmet option for enhancing both traditional African meals and contemporary recipes. Ideal for food enthusiasts and chefs seeking to add a unique, flavorful ingredient to their culinary creations.

fields.name: Cassava flakes
fields.description: Abacha, also known as African salad, is made from finely shredded and sun-dried cassava. A staple in Nigerian cuisine, it offers a chewy texture and a mildly tangy flavor, perfect for preparing traditional dishes like Abacha salad. Often mixed with palm oil, vegetables, and seasonings, Abacha is a versatile, gluten-free ingredient that can be enjoyed as a snack or a light meal. Ideal for home cooks and food enthusiasts seeking authentic African flavors, it provides a quick and convenient base for a variety of creative dishes.

fields.name: Cameroon pepper
fields.description: Cameroon pepper is a fiery, aromatic spice known for its bold heat and smoky flavor. Made from dried, ground African chili peppers, it adds an intense kick to a wide range of dishes, from soups and stews to grilled meats and sauces. Prized in West African cuisine for its rich, spicy depth, Cameroon pepper is perfect for anyone looking to enhance their meals with authentic African heat and flavor. Whether you're a home cook or a professional chef, this spice will bring a robust, peppery punch to your favorite recipes.

fields.name: Mellon Seeds
fields.description: Melon seeds, also known as Egusi seeds, are nutrient-rich seeds harvested from specific types of melons. Popular in West African cuisine, these seeds are ground into a fine powder and used as a thickener in traditional dishes like Egusi soup. Known for their mild, nutty flavor and smooth texture, melon seeds are packed with protein, healthy fats, and essential nutrients. They are perfect for home cooks and chefs looking to create authentic, hearty African meals, offering a rich, creamy base for soups and stews.

fields.name: Hibiscus leaves (Zobo)
fields.description: Hibiscus flowers are vibrant, dried blooms renowned for their rich color and tangy, floral flavor. Often used to make refreshing beverages like Zobo tea, these flowers are packed with antioxidants and vitamin C, offering a burst of health benefits and a delightful, slightly tart taste. Ideal for crafting herbal teas, infusions, or as a colorful ingredient in cooking and baking, hibiscus flowers are perfect for home cooks and health enthusiasts looking to add a touch of natural, vibrant flavor to their culinary creations.

fields.name: test
fields.description: testing and updating even again, and again
